data.Sentence_cn: 开往威斯特海温的快车
data.Sentence: --- lesson 37  The westhaven Express

data.Sentence_cn: 我们已经习惯于相信火车总是准点的。
data.Sentence: We have learnt to expect that trains will be punctual.

data.Sentence_cn: 经过多年的适应，大多数人对火车时刻表产生了一种不可动摇的信念。
data.Sentence: After years of conditioning, most of us have developed an unshakable faith in railway timetables.

data.Sentence_cn: 轮船船期可能因风暴而推延，
data.Sentence: Ships may be delayed by storms;

data.Sentence_cn: 飞机航班可能因恶劣天气而取消，唯有火车必然是准点的。
data.Sentence: flights may be cancelled because of bad weather, but trains must be on time.

data.Sentence_cn: 只有非同寻常的大雪才可能暂时打乱铁路运行。
data.Sentence: Only an exceptionally heavy snowfall might temporarily dislocate railway services.

data.Sentence_cn: 因此，一旦铁路上真出了问题，人们便不加思索地责备铁路当局。
data.Sentence: It is all too easy to blame the railway authorities when something does go wrong.

data.Sentence_cn: 事实上，差错很可能是我们自己，而不是铁路当局的。
data.Sentence: The truth is that when mistakes occur, they are more likely to be ours than theirs.

data.Sentence_cn: 我查看了列车时刻表，满意地了解到有一趟去威斯特海温的快车。
data.Sentence: After consulting my railway timetable, I noted with satisfaction that there was an express train to Westhaven.

data.Sentence_cn: 这是趟直达车，旅途总共才需1小时17分钟。
data.Sentence: It went direct from my local station and the journey lasted a mere hour and seventeen minutes.

data.Sentence_cn: 上车后，我不禁注意到许多当地人也上了车。
data.Sentence: When I boarded the train, I could not help noticing that a great many local people got on as well.

data.Sentence_cn: 一开始，我并不感到奇怪，
data.Sentence: At the time, this did not strike me as odd.

data.Sentence_cn: 我想除我之外，想利用快车之便的也一定大有人在。
data.Sentence: I reflected that there must be a great many people besides myself who wished to take advantage of this excellent service.

data.Sentence_cn: 火车开出几英里即在一个小站威德里停了下来。对此，我不觉得奇怪，
data.Sentence: Neither was I surprised when the train stopped at Widley, a tiny station a few miles along the line.

data.Sentence_cn: 因为即便是特别快车也可能被信号拦住。
data.Sentence: Even a mighty express train can be held up by signals.

data.Sentence_cn: 但是，当火车一站接着一站往前蠕动时，我便产生了怀疑。
data.Sentence: But when the train dawdled at station after station, I began to wonder.

data.Sentence_cn: 我突然感到这趟快车并没以时速90英里的速度呼啸前进，而是卟哧卟哧地向前爬行，时速仅30英里。
data.Sentence: It suddenly dawned on me that this express was not roaring down the line at ninety miles an hour, but barely chugging along at thirty.

data.Sentence_cn: 1小时17分过去了，走了还不到一半路程。
data.Sentence: One hour and seventeen minutes passed and we had not even covered half the distance.

data.Sentence_cn: 我问一位乘客，这是不是开往威斯特海温的那趟快车，他说从未听说过有这么一趟快车。
data.Sentence: I asked a passenger if this was the Westhaven Express, but he had not even heard of it.

data.Sentence_cn: 我决定一到目的地就给铁路部门提意见。
data.Sentence: I determined to lodge a complaint as soon as we arrived.

data.Sentence_cn: 两小时后，我气呼呼地同威斯特海温站站长说起此事。
data.Sentence: Two hours later, I was talking angrily to the station master at Westhaven.

data.Sentence_cn: 他说根本没有这趟车。于是我借他本人的列车时刻表，
data.Sentence: When he denied the train's existence, I borrowed his copy of the timetable.

data.Sentence_cn: 我带着一种胜利者的调子告诉他那趟车白纸黑字、明明白白印在时刻表上。
data.Sentence: There was a note of triumph in my voice when I told him that it was there in black and white.

data.Sentence_cn: 他迅速地扫视了一眼，让我再看一遍。
data.Sentence: Glancing at it briefly, he told me to look again.

data.Sentence_cn: 一个小小的星形符号把我的目光引到了那页底部一个说明上。
data.Sentence: A tiny asterisk conducted me to a footnote at the bottom of the page.

data.Sentence_cn: 上面写着：“此趟列车暂停运行。”
data.Sentence: It said: 'This service has been suspended.'

title.title_cn: 开往威斯特海温的快车
title.title: The westhaven Express
